exclusion:
1. Press the Action Button on your Switch.
  2. If your switch has been successfully unlinked from your network, its LED will become a rainbow gradient. If linking was unsuccessful, the LED will become green or purple depending on how your LED mode is set.
inclusion:
1. Press the Action Button on your Switch once and the LED will flash a green LED.
  2. If your switch has been successfully linked to your network, its LED will become solid green for 2 seconds. If linking was unsuccessful, the LED will return to a rainbow gradient.
label: ZWA006
overview: The Aeotec Smart boost timer switch is used to control immersion heaters or other switched loads up to 16 amps.  It also allows for a manual boost of up to two hours.  Suitable for indor use only.  Fits in a single UK electrial back box.  Z-Wave Plus S2 with smart start, 16 amps, monitor power use, backup battery
usage:
Color Indications
Flashing Blue -Not paired to any Z-Wave network.
Red - Pairing was unsuccessful, need to retry pairing.
White - System is on, schedule is programmed, but switch is off.
Yellow - Switch is on.
Orange - The switch is on, but the load connected is over 100W
No Light - No power to switch.

Installation
Only a licensed electrician with knowledge and understanding of electrical systems and safety should complete the installation.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Power Out Action
parameters.description: Power out action Action in case of power out. This parameter is used to configure the device state after power on.
parameters.overview:
0 - keep the last state when re-power on
1 - power on
2 - power off
3 - return to standard schedule (see schedule command class) so this would either be on or off depending on schedule and the time.

options.label: keep the last state when re-power on
return to standard schedule (see schedule command class) so this would

parameters.label: LED status
parameters.description: Configure LED (except boost) to be off irrespective of switch status.
parameters.overview:
0 - disable all LED except for boost
1 - enable all LED indication
2 - Momentary mode (LED turns on for 5 seconds, then turn off LED)

options.label: disable all LED except for boost
Momentary mode (LED turns on for 5 seconds, then turn off LED

parameters.label: Auto off timer
parameters.description: Timer acts as auto off after specified minutes, setting is set in seconds.
parameters.overview:
0 - no auto off with timer
1 ~ 86400 auto off after this specified time, unit second.

options.label: auto off after this specified time, unit second.

parameters.label: Current overload protection
parameters.overview:
0 - disable current and overload protection
1 - enable current and overload protection

parameters.label: Boost time
parameters.description: Configure boost time interval, unit minute.
parameters.overview: When user press the boost button one time, the boost time will increase 30 (the value can be changed) minutes.

parameters.label: LED threshold setting
parameters.description: This parameter is used to configure the power led threshold, unit W. When the load <= 100W, the power led will indicate yellow. When the load > 100W, the power led will indicate orange. When no load, the power led will indicate white.

parameters.label: kWh threshold setting
parameters.description: Threshold settings for energy kWh. When the energy above the threshold, it will send a meter report command to gateway.

parameters.label: Watt threshold setting
parameters.description: Threshold settings for Watt automatic report, unit W. When Watt above the threshold, it will send a meter report command to gateway.

parameters.label: Current threshold setting
parameters.description: Threshold settings for Current automatic report, unit 0.1A. When current above the threshold, it will send a meter report command to gateway.

parameters.label: Watt report interval
parameters.description: Watt automatic report interval, unit second.

parameters.label: kWh report interval
parameters.description: kWh automatic report interval, unit second.

parameters.label: Voltage report interval
parameters.description: Voltage automatic report interval, unit second.

parameters.label: Current report interval
parameters.description: Current automatic report interval, unit second.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Group 1 is lifeline group, all nodes which associated in this group will receive the messages sent by device through lifeline.

associations.label: On/off
associations.overview: Group 2 is a basic group, all nodes which associated in this group will receive a basic set command sent by this group. When the device is on, a basic set command with 0xFF value will be sent. When the device is off, a basic set command with 0x00 value will be sent.
